dev.lyze.gdxUnBox2d

Class UnBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.lyze.gdxUnBox2d.UnBox

  • public class UnBox
extends java.lang.Object

    The main object of the library. Holds all game objects and behaviours. Additionally, calculates physics with Box2D.

    Make sure to call preRender(float), render(Batch), postRender() in your ApplicationListener.render() loop in this order.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UnBox()
      Instantiates an instance of this object with a Box2D World with (0, 0) gravity.

      Instantiates an instance of this object.

    • Method Detail

      • preRender

        public void preRender(float delta)
        Starts behaviours, calls fixedUpdate(float), updateGameObjects(float) and lateUpdateGameObjects(float).o Call this at the beginning of your render loop.
        Parameters:
        delta - The delta time compared to the previous time. Graphics.getDeltaTime()

      • adjustExecutionOrder

        public void adjustExecutionOrder()

      • render

        public void render(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
        Renders behaviours. Call this after preRender(float).
        Parameters:
        batch - The batch used to render the behaviours.

      • debugRender

        public void debugRender(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer renderer)
        Renders behaviours with a shape renderer, therefore commonly used for debugging. Call this after preRender(float).
        Parameters:
        renderer - The shape renderer used to render the behaviours.

        Parameters:

        public void postRender()
        Instantiates and destroys pending game objects or behaviours. Call this after render(Batch).

        Marks the game object and all its behaviour for deletion at the end of the current frame.

      • findBehaviours

        public <T extends Behaviour> com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<T> findBehaviours(java.lang.Class<T> behaviourClass)
        Finds all behaviour instances with the specified type. Allocations an array inside this method.
        Parameters:
        behaviourClass - The class type we want to search for.
        Returns:
        The found behaviour or null.

      • findBehaviours

        public <T extends Behaviour> com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<T> findBehaviours(java.lang.Class<T> behaviourClass,
                                                                            com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<T> tempStorage)
        Finds all behaviour instances with the specified type.
        Parameters:
        behaviourClass - The class type we want to search for.
        tempStorage - A temporary array to store all behaviours in it. Therefore, there's no array allocation happening in this method.
        Returns:
        All found behaviours or empty array.

      • findBehaviour

        public <T extends Behaviour> T findBehaviour(java.lang.Class<T> behaviourClass)
        Find the first behaviour instance with the specified type.
        Parameters:
        behaviourClass - The class type we want to search for.
        Returns:
        The first behaviour or null.

      • invalidateRenderOrder

        public void invalidateRenderOrder()
        When a behaviours render order gets updated unBox doesn't get notified about that, hence you need to call this method afterwards.

      • findBehaviour

        public Behaviour findBehaviour(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body bodyToFind)
        Helper method to find the behaviour based on a Box2D Body.
        Parameters:
        bodyToFind - The Box2D body to search for.
        Returns:
        The GameObject if found, or null.

      • insertSingleton

        public void insertSingleton(java.lang.Object obj)
        Inserts a singleton into the system. The key value is set to 'default' for this singleton.
        Parameters:
        obj - The singleton.

      • insertSingleton

        public <T> void insertSingleton(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                java.lang.Object obj)
        Inserts a singleton into the system with a different type. The key value is set to 'default' for this singleton.
        Parameters:
        type - The type the class should be represented. For example if you want to `getSingleton(Viewport.class)` you can use this to store an `insertSingleton(Viewport.class, new ExtendViewport(...))`
        obj - The singleton.

      • insertSingleton

        public <T> void insertSingleton(java.lang.String key,
                                java.lang.Object obj)
        Inserts a singleton into the system with a key value.
        Parameters:
        key - The keyed value.
        obj - The singleton.

      • insertSingleton

        public <T> void insertSingleton(java.lang.String key,
                                java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                java.lang.Object obj)
        Inserts a singleton into the system with a key value.
        Parameters:
        key - The keyed value.
        obj - The singleton.

      • getSingleton

        public <T> T getSingleton(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Gets a singleton from the system with the 'default' key value.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the singleton.
        Returns:
        The singleton or null if the type doesn't exist.

      • getSingleton

        Gets a simple singleton from the system.
        Parameters:

        type - The type of the singleton.
        Returns:
        The singleton or null if the type doesn't exist.
